t: A Psalm; a Song at the Dedication of the House. A Psalm of David.
I*pn will extol You, O Lord,*s for You have lifted me up, And*ln have not let my enemies rejoice over me.
O*ln Lord*s my God, I*ln cried to You for help, and You healed me.
O*ln Lord,*s You have brought up my soul from Sheol; You*ln have kept me alive, that I would not go down to the pit.
Sing*ln praise to the Lord,*s you His godly ones, And*ln give thanks to His holy name.
For*ln His anger is but for a moment, His*ln favor is for a lifetime; Weeping*ln may last for the night, But*ln a shout of joy comes*i in the morning.
Now*ln as for me, I said in my prosperity, “I*ln will never be moved.”
O*ln Lord,*s by Your favor You have made my mountain to stand strong; You*ln hid Your face, I was dismayed.
To*ln You, O Lord,*s I called, And*ln to the Lord I made supplication:
“What*ln profit is there in my blood, if I go down to the pit? Will*ln the dust praise You? Will it declare Your faithfulness?
“Hear,*ln O Lord,*s and be gracious to me; O*ln Lord,*s be my helper.”
You*ln have turned for me my mourning into dancing; You*ln have loosed my sackcloth and girded me with gladness,
That*ln my*i soul may sing praise to You and not be silent. O*ln Lord*s my God, I will give thanks to You forever.
